conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: Lately I've just been exhausted all the time. I wake up tired, and by midday I feel like I can barely function.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: When did this start?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: A couple of months ago, maybe late May? It's gotten worse over time.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Have you been sleeping poorly, or is it more like even after sleeping you still feel drained?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: I do sleep, but it doesn't feel restful. I can sleep 8 hours and still feel like I didn't sleep at all.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Any trouble focusing or remembering things?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: Yes, that's been really frustrating. I'll be in meetings and completely lose track. It's like my brain is in a fog.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Have you been feeling down or disinterested in things you usually enjoy?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: I wouldn't say depressed, but I've definitely been feeling overwhelmed and kind of emotionally flat.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: How about physical symptoms? Any changes in your weight, hair, or skin?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: Actually, yes. I've noticed my hair's been thinning more than usual. And my skin feels really dry lately.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: How's your period been?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: Much heavier, and it lasts longer. I used to be done in 4 days, now it's more like 6 or 7, and I need to change pads every couple of hours.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Do you have a history of anemia or thyroid issues?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: I was borderline anemic a few years ago, but no thyroid problems that I know of.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Have you had COVID in the past year?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: Yes, I had a mild case back in March. Just a sore throat and cough for a few days, but nothing major.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Did your symptoms start after that?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: Now that you mention itâ€¦ yeah, I think the fatigue started a few weeks after I recovered.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: We received your lab results from this morning. Ferritin is 8 ng/mL (low), hemoglobin 10.9 g/dL (low), and MCV 76 fL (microcytic). This pattern is consistent with iron deficiency anemia.

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: That makes sense given how tired I've been.

complaint: Chronic fatigue and cognitive issues following COVID infection, with associated physical symptoms including hair thinning, dry skin, and heavy menstrual periods
